ratings.comment: Very interesting lectures and she is very knowledgeable. Exams are tough but if you attend class, you will do fine.

One of the witchiest professors I've ever had. She once downgraded me because I had capitalized a word in the title of my essay. If you do anything wrong at all ever in that class, you'll be doomed for the rest of the semester. Also, she assigns a ton of homework, but we don't do anything in class. Unfortunately, attendance is mandatory.

I loved this class. Linguistics is my favorite aspect of Spanish. Prof. Harrington had great PowerPoints that explained everything you need to know. This class greatly improved my Spanish accent! Doing IPA transcriptions was actually pretty fun. Tests are very fair - I was always prepared for the tests by doing homework and doing some studying.
Is very good teacher

Prof Harrington is an excellent teacher. Make sure to print out her lecture notes before class so you can follow along. The exams are easy since she gives you a clear outline of what exactly will be on them. I will be taking future classes with her!

I loved this class. Professor Harrington is a great and clear professor. There are only 3 exams, 1 quiz and 1 final project, so the class is not terribly difficult or stressful. It is clear that she enjoys her job, she is always in a good mood and open to any questions. I plan to take more classes with her, she is wonderful!

Stasie was an amazing professor! Print her note sheets for every lecture and you'll be fine. Exams are very clear cut and her expectations are very clear. If you do the work, you'll do fine. This course has a lot of new material, but Stasie is always willing to help! Great personality and very outgoing. Would highly recommend her!!

I'm a great Spanish student and this is by far the most challenging class that I have ever taken. Not only is the material totally new, but the course is difficult and unclear. Tough to study for this class. Be sure to put work into it but don't expect any help.

I'm a Spanish Major and this is by far the hardest Spanish class I've taken. The assignments and required things are not clear whatsoever. The whole class is confusing and she doesn't offer much help. If possible, take the class with someone else.

Spanish 320 is a tough class and Stasie is a tough teacher. Met twice a week with a power lecture where she basically went through her powerpoint and you take notes on pre-printed notes she provides. Goes through the power points very fast and won't put them online for some reason. Tough class, study in advance for sure and don't bomb the first one

Very good teacher and very helpful. I took 226 and 311 before taking 320 (Phonetics), which was a little more difficult. However, Prof. Harrington taught the material clearly and at a reasonable pace. 3 exams and a final project. Make sure you take notes during her Powerpoint lectures, as the exams are based off of them.

The portfolio assignment is the most insignificant thing I've done while at UW-Madison, and it takes up WAY too much time.  I normally love Spanish but I dread doing work for this class. It's "organized" but not in a clear way. She gives you instructions with pages long of text, very hard to decipher. Don't take this class, it's awful.

The class is Advanced Conversation, but I spoke more in my writing course than in this class.  Instead of having the students speak, She "talks" at the students. There is a big portfolio assignment, which is very time consuming and hard to understand the requirements. They are not clearly laid out and many did poorly in the course.  Don't take 325.

Great professor! I took this class as a summer class and was worried about the pace, but it was very manageable. She was well organized and her notes were very helpful. All of her assigned homework was helpful and relevant. Great attidude and very approachable. Definitely recommend taking her, she was one of the best spanish professor's I've had!

Amazing instructor. She really wants her students to succeed, and wants to ensure that you are understanding the material. I took 320 as a summer course, and was worried about the pace of the class. It was a breeze and she let us drop our lowest exam. Definitely take her if you can!
She's great! This was my favorite spanish class so far. Stasie is very nice, fun, and accomodating. Easy A if you keep up with weekly reading and activities
Took Phonetics over the summer with her.  Easy A.  4 exams (no quizzes) and a grabacion. The final was a one paged, double page, bulletpoint format analysis of the grabacion.  Take her if you can!

Horrible instructor. Designs classes that are not at all constructive to learning a language. To top it off, her Spanish was not that good either. She's also very demanding and picky. Everything has to go exactly her way. Very harsh grader. Possibly the worst professor in the Spanish department at Madison.

Took this class after 6 enjoyable semesters of Spanish in high school.  I've decided not to take any more Spanish.  Stasie has all the class info/sources on the web, and it isn't well organized; if you ask for help she will tell you to look at L@UW or say she already went over it in class.  Pointless busywork that won't help you understand.

She is as unhelpful to her students as she can possibly be.  Ask a question and expect a vague and useless response.  If you email to ask for clarification, expect to be directed to the syllabus that you have already read that is just as unhelpful as she is.  Also, expect pop quizzes, weekly self-evaluation, and lots of busy work cerca high school.

Senora Harrington is a wonderful professor who is extremely organized and who clearly has a passion for the language. However, she is not easy and slackers will certainly do poorly in her class. If you show you care about the subject and try hard, you will end up with an A or an AB. She also appreciates it if you try to get to know her personally.

Professor Harrington is a wonderful teacher. She is passionate about what she teaches, but is more or less demanding. If you really want to get a lot out of this class, take Harrington. Do all the homework, do well on the trabajos escritos and participate often, and you'll receive an A.
